glossary.title: --- INFO / GLOSSARY ---
glossary.operations:
1. Column descriptions of the Report tables
    2. Info on metrics/statistics

page_1.title: Report's columns description
page_1.date:
- Date
    Date when the operation was executed on.
page_1.account:
- Account
    Account on which the operation was performed.
page_1.operation:
- Operation
    Type of operation (Buy, Sell, Deposit...)
page_1.product:
- Product
    Type of product (Stock, ETF, Cash...)
page_1.ticker:
- Ticker
    Security ticker if specified. Follows Yahoo Finance standard.
page_1.asset_name:
- Asset Name
    Full name of the security.
page_1.ter:
- TER
    For eligible products, annualized Total Expense Ratio.
page_1.currency:
- Currency
    Currency of the operation (currently supported: EUR, USD).
page_1.exch_rate:
- Exch. Rate
    EUR-USD conversion rate of the operation.
page_1.qt_exch:
- Exch. Qty
    Quantity of the security exchanged in the current operation. Positive if Buy, negative if Sell.
page_1.price:
- Price
    Unit price in original currency. Negative if Buy, positive if Sell.
page_1.eur_price:
- Price EUR
    Unit price in EUR. Negative if Buy, positive if Sell.
page_1.nominal_value:
- Nominal Value
    Direct value of the operation. For securities, equals Exch. Qty * Price EUR.
page_1.fees:
- Fees
    Commissions applied by the broker for the operation.
page_1.qt_held:
- Curr. Qty
    Current quantity of the security after the current operation.
page_1.avg_price:
- Avg Cost
    Weighted Average Carrying Price of the security. Prices include commissions.
    ( sum[i=1->n] Qty[i] * Price[i] )  /  ( sum[i=1->n] Qty[i] )
page_1.avg_value:
- Residual Cost
    Residual Amount of the asset. Calculated as Avg Cost * Curr. Qty.
page_1.eff_value:
- Eff. Value
    Effective amount of the operation net of any commissions.
page_1.released_value:
- Cost Released
    Cost released after the sale of an asset. Calculated as Avg Cost * Exch. Qty.
page_1.gross_cap_gain:
- Gross Cap Gain
    Gross capital gain generated by the sale. Calculated as Eff. Value - Cost Released.
page_1.cap_loss:
- Cap Loss Gen.
    Capital loss generated by the operation. For some products (e.g., ETFs) can also be generated on purchase (fee loss).
page_1.exp_date:
- Expiry
    Expiration date of the capital loss, after which it can no longer be offset.
page_1.backpack:
- Tax Carryforward
    Tracks total capital losses yet to be offset, and handles removing them upon expiration.
page_1.cap_gain_tax:
- Taxable Cap Gain
    Capital gain on which tax will actually be paid. Reduced in case of offsettable capital losses.
    Assuming gain=20€, carryforward=5€, tax is paid only on 20-5 = 15€, instead of 20€.
page_1.tax_amount:
- Tax
    Tax paid, calculated on the taxable capital gain.
page_1.pl:
- P&L
    Profit & Loss of the sale. Calculated as Gross Cap Gain - Tax.
page_1.cash_held:
- Current Cash
    Cash available in the account after the operation.
page_1.assets_value:
- Asset Value
    Value of securities held in the account after the operation.
page_1.nav:
- NAV
    Net Asset Value after the operation. Calculated as Current Cash + Asset Value.
page_1.historic_cash:
- Committed Cash
    Total liquidity injected into the account. Considers only deposits and withdrawals.

page_2.title: Information on statistical tools
page_2.xirr:
XIRR (Extended Internal Rate of Return).
	IRR is a numerical method to calculate the Internal Rate of Return of a series of cash flows (inflows and outflows); XIRR is a variant
	used when flows occur at irregular time intervals. It is calculated as the rate that zeros the Net Present Value (NPV) of all flows.
	Useful for measuring personal performance, taking into account investment and divestment choices.
page_2.twrr:
TWRR (Time-Weighted Rate of Return).
	Focuses on the return of the assets and not the effective return of the investor (essentially excluding cash flows).
	The calculation is based on the geometric mean of returns of all sub-periods into which the investment is divided (e.g., daily, monthly).
	Useful for comparing performance with benchmarks/indices or measuring statistics such as the Sharpe Ratio.
page_2.volatility:
- Volatility
    Standard deviation of returns over a specific time period.
page_2.sharpe_ratio:
- Sharpe Ratio
    Measures the performance of an investment compared to a 'risk-free' asset (e.g., AAA short-term government bonds' interest rate).
 It is calculated as the difference between investment returns and risk-free returns, called excess returns, divided by the standard deviation of excess returns.
page_2.corr:
- Simple Correlation
    Measures, via a coefficient between -1 and 1, how correlated two assets are at a given moment.
    +1: the two assets are positively correlated: as the first increases, the second increases (and vice versa).
    0: the two assets are perfectly uncorrelated: a change in the first one will not affect the second one in any way (and vice versa).
    -1: the two assets are negatively correlated: as the first increases, the second decreases (and vice versa).
page_2.corr_roll:
- Rolling Correlation
    Calculated similarly to the previous one, but over a pre-established time interval (e.g., 5 years); furthermore,
    a rolling average with a specified interval (in days) is applied; this interval is recommended to be 100-150 for a history greater than 2 years, 20-60 otherwise.
 Offers a measure of how the correlation between two assets changes over time.
page_2.drawdown:
- Drawdown
    Measures the percentage decline in the value of the portfolio (or an asset) from its historic peak to the subsequent minimum.
    Maximum Drawdown, specifically, reports the largest difference.
page_2.var:
- Value at Risk (VaR)
    Maximum expected loss over a specified time horizon in days, given a confidence interval.
    The implementation used here is based on the Monte Carlo method, using historical data for return estimates.
